description: ONETOC files are created by OneNote when you create a OneNote notebook by selecting File â†’ New in OneNote. ONETOC files are not meant to be manually opened. It is instead referenced by OneNote when opening a notebook. If you delete the ONETOC file, OneNote will display the notebook sections in alphabetical order, which you can manually reorder.
NOTE: ONETOC files are used by Microsoft OneNote 2003. The file was replaced by .ONETOC2 with the release of OneNote 2007.
